inclusion.criterion: Clinical diagnosis of acute perforated appendicitis
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Diagnostic laparoscopy revealed phlegmon with no other abdominal abnormalities.

inclusion.criterion: fit for laparoscopy and general anesthesia.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He is now a candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.

inclusion.criterion: short term outcome data and agree to provide contact information.
inclusion.label: met

notes: 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. CT scan showed evidence of acute perforated appendicitis.
